intro: Echinostachys pineliana, commonly known as the Mexican feather grass, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a perennial grass that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry, rocky habitats. The plant produces delicate, feathery plumes that give it its common name, and it is valued for its ornamental appearance in gardens. Echinostachys pineliana is also known for its drought tolerance and ability to stabilize soil in arid environments. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for xeriscaping and native plant gardens.
